title: either revert the aery nerf or give ap mages a real keystone
body:
ap mages feel underwhelming when there are options for AD champions to itemize both damage and MR while ap do not. not to mention with nullifying orb pretty much everybody gets a free hexdrinker passive while there is no similar rune for physical damage.

keystones on ap champions feel bad in its current state. aery is a support keystone that barely boosts damage while comet is actually useless without any immobilizing abilities. anybody with shoes or even without can easily avoid the comet and for some reason comet has a cooldown when it would still be useless without a cd.

why can't we get a simple keystone that just does more damage like deathfires touch?

replies.body:
Ermn, going to respectfully disagree here. Agree with Skorch on his Comet comments and will add that Aery actually significantly boosts damage (possibly even more than Comet, depending on the situation & player) if you are consistently re-positioning to reduce the cooldown & grab the damage proc again (so like, not even using the shield bit). 

The issue with Deathfire Touch as a keystone, which we've talked about before, is that it had very little gameplay. You just...got more damage... in exchange for nothing. I know it was really fun for mage players because you just...got more damage (and that's fun!)...but the pattern was not producing good play or counterplay (in that...there was no pattern). This is actually also somewhat related to why we switched up the triggers to Electrocute, etc., to require more specific interaction on the side of the rune users. 

So, TL;DR, we probably won't see something EXACTLY like Deathfire Touch in the new system because it didn't produce meaningful gameplay.

**EDIT:** The amount of people threatening to quit League & making hyperbolic statements ("everybody knows that" etc.) because I ventured in to comment here is TOO DAMN HIGH haha

https://imgflip.com/s/meme/Too-Damn-High.jpg

I can't speak for MCHammer, but from what I understand they're comparing the Sorcery tree to the Precision tree: in Precision, two of the three keystones are activated from a single autoattack, and PTA is activated by three. There are conditions to these effects, but in the end they can all be applied with a fair amount of reliability by ranged champions, as ranged autoattacks are reliable and can be applied pretty quickly, and so give a lot of power to ranged autoattackers.

By contrast, Arcane Comet is often more difficult for ranged champions to land, as it has a travel speed, and this is in addition to it requiring an ability to activate it, as abilities are generally less reliable than ranged autoattacks. Phase Rush isn't particularly great for mages, whose abilities may not hit reliably and who don't necessarily want movement speed, so in the end their most reliable option is Aerie, which has been nerfed for its power relative to its gameplay.

In this respect, current runes feel like it's easier for a ranged autoattacker to get use out of them than a mage: mages generally have to land at least one ability _and_ fulfill another condition to unlock the power of a Sorcery keystone, whereas ranged autoattackers only really have to worry about their Precision keystone's particular gameplay effect, as their autoattacks tend to be very reliable.

can you guys at least provide enchanter supports a keystone that feels good to use outside of *ugh* Aery?
Why the ugh? Would love some feedback on what you don't like about Aery or what new thing you would want as an Enchanter support player. :)

For enchanters, I believe Aery is fine. Though, Aery also seems to be best for constant damage mages like Taliyah. This is where I find issue.

Aery just isn't interesting to use. Its annoying to see on screen, annoying to get hit by, and feels just plain bad to use on a mage when your kit screams damage. An entire half of Aery's kit revolves around shielding, and if she is taken purely for damage, half of her goes unused. Also, as a mage, the catching game isn't fun, at least in my opinion.

Aery feels like tacked on up front damage, which is almost like a bad easy to proc up front version of thunderlords in a way. I would almost rather not have a keystone and have that power in the kit then use that thing.
Gotcha - so basically you're happy as an Enchanter player using Aery and unhappy when you can only use half of the keystone as a Mage player? I can see that. Thanks for the feedback!

Here's my stance with Comet and Aery:

Aery feels bad when there's no way to apply the ally shield. It really feels like a rune meant for a utility mage or an enchanter and many who are forced to use it do so knowing it's because it's the "only option".

Comet has a different problem, in that unless you have a way of applying a CC, many champs can avoid it too easily. And in other cases its damage feels lackluster especially when the enemy CAN avoid it so much. And so they take Aery instead, which then feels suboptimal because they can't use the ally shield.

The main problem is it really feels like there's no rune for mages with little/unreliable cc and no ally utility.

If anything, I'd like to see Comet be stronger and even harder to hit and another rune introduced for other mages with little/unrelaible cc.

Edit: I should complete my thoughts. Phase rush is not optimal on all mages, and this is not even in the running as a third option in my mind (not that I think it's bad, it's my fave rune on Syndra but it's definitely not for everyone)

Logically, you'd think "then try a different tree and keystone" but the problem is that Electrocute is the only other logical choice; after all, Thunderlord's Decree was a great option on a lot of mages, but a whopping 50 second cooldown early on makes the rune almost unusable and not worth it for what's lost in trade potential in lane. Which again, is fine, I like the new Electrocute as a jungling option since you'd only ever gank every 50 seconds or so and it feels appropriately powerful.

We just REALLY need another rune for mages. They, and bruisers who favored fervor, are just not getting catered to the way everyone else is.

Something dedicated to a heal/shield playstyle is something I've looked for. Aery's bonus shield is not great, and while I understand why, the pattern of poke, then they respond, even if I time my shield right (ala windspeakers) they most likely won't get the bonus. 

I liked windspeaker's, even removing the shield/heal buff and giving a def stat bonus on cast for a sec for rewarding well-timed healing/shielding would be nice.\

I see what you're saying here - something very focused on Enchanter wants/stats specifically. Thanks for the feedback! Can never promise anything as the result of it, but I appreciate you explaining your feelings

The problem is they actually give a support design rune to an adc called Press the attack. I hate this rune design on this kind of playstyle, it doesnt fit the carry style gameplay but somehow they did it. Rune design around team amplication dmg shouldnt be into precision tree since it is too easy for them to abuse the rune as a result we have a tree which give too much snowball potential.

Aery feels underwhelming relative to Windspeakers. I end up running Klepto on Janna more often than not as the extra gold and free potions/wards end up being far more valuable to me than the barely noticeable shield boost Aery provides.

That being said, if the shield boost were changed to some sort of buff (Armor/MR/slow protection/something) it would make it far more rewarding to use the proc defensively and not just as a little extra poke in lane for an enchanter.

On the flip side, Aery feels alright on very aggressive enchanters like Morgana, Karma, and Sona (before she was nerfed back into obscurity).

The problem with Aery is the consistency.

It is WAY WAY too consistent to ever provide a strong damage boost.

Comet is harder to land, and has a longer CD.

Electrocute has a long CD and requires at least some work to land (you can argue, but 3 skills is still 3 skills).

PtA requires 3 hits to activate.

Lethal Tempo has the build up period before it activates

Fleet Foot had the recharge period.

Meanwhile Aery is just consistent because you just need to hit them once, and then back off. Consistent increase in damage where every other damage increase requires some work on the players part.

So whenever Aery is strong, it is going to completely dominate if anyone actually can use it/

I put Aery on Singed and was completely flabbergasted at how much bonus damage it got me.
even after the nerf, I don't see Aery as weak. It gets stronger with low cd attacks and shorter range. You could probably put it on someone like J4 or Zac and be totally fine.
